w:r.w:t: Students will be introduced to personal pronouns as well as some school names such as teacher and student. This lesson will help lay the foundation students need to communicate about themselves and the world around them.
At completion of this lesson, the student will be able to:
Learning objective 2: Read and spell personal pronouns
Learning objective 3: Recognize students and teachers.
r, student, I, me, you, he, she
This slide will always be the
-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: Today we will be learning about pronouns and school words.
Visual cue: show pictures of teachers.
TPR: point to yourself and say teacher.
Visual cue: draw a circle on the screen.
TPR: Circle in the air and say circle.
Instruct the student to circle the teacher.
Visual cue: show pictures of students.
Use TPR to point to student saying, “you are a student.”
Have the student repeat: “I am a student.”
cue: make a circle on a whiteboard.
TPR: Make a circle in the air.
Ask the student to circle the students.
Have the student repeat: “They are students.”
TPR: point toward yourself and say me.
TPR: point toward the student and say me.
Visual Cue: show drawing a line on a piece of paper or on the screen.
Have the student draw a line between the words and the correct picture.
Circle the girl and say she.
Circle the boy and say he.
Ask: Which one is he? Circle he.
: Which one is she? Circle she.
Identifies the appropriate pronoun for each person.
Circle one student and say “she” have the student repeat the activity and circle each student saying “she” or “he
Complete the sentence frame by filling in the blank
Circle the girl and say: She is a student.
Have the student repeat the sentence.
Complete the sentence frame by filling in the blank
Circle the boy and say: “He is a student.”
Have the student repeat the sentence: “He is a student.
Circle the girl and ask: Who is she?
Allow the student to respond: “She is a student.”
Circle the boy and ask: Who is he?
Allow the student to respond: “He is a student.”
student write me, you, he and she on the blackboard.
If the student has trouble write the word and have them copy it.
Ask: “Who is she?” while circling the teacher.
Allow the student to respond by saying: “She is the teacher.”
the new words by looking at the pictures.
Review some of the new words
learned in today’s lesson. Circle each picture and allow the student to say the correct pronoun or word (student teacher)
Freeform “Show and Tell” Conversation Activity Slide
Student writes the words: I, me, he, she
or you, draws teacher or student.
Blank slide for student to draw or write.
Word Wall Vocabulary Builder Activity (Summative Assessment)
teacher, student, I, me, you, he, she
words and ask the student to circle as they hear the words.
If there is time ask the student to read all of the words with teacher support.
Have students spell number words out loud by covering their eyes as they recite the letters.
